item.title: Netflix to redesign its app as it competes with social platforms for daily engagement
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: At the center of the redesign is deeper integration of vertical video feeds, which the streaming giant has been experimenting with since May.

item.title: One-time hot insurance tech Ethos poised to be first tech IPO of the year
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Ethos was backed by a who's who of VCs and celebs through 2021. It is currently profitable, it says.

item.title: In an effort to protect young users, ChatGPT will now predict how old you are
item.dc:creator: Lucas Ropek
item.description: The feature is designed to stop problematic content from being delivered to users under the age of 18.

item.title: Elon Musk says Tesla’s restarted Dojo3 will be for ‘space-based AI compute’
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Tesla aims to restart work on Dojo3, its previously abandoned third-generation AI chip. Only this time, Dojo3 won’t be aimed at training self-driving models on Earth. Instead, Musk says it will be dedicated to “space-based AI compute.”

item.title: X open sources its algorithm while facing a transparency fine and Grok controversies
item.dc:creator: Lucas Ropek
item.description: In a post to GitHub on Tuesday, the social media giant purported to share its secret sauce.

item.title: Luminar founder Austin Russell agrees to accept subpoena in bankruptcy case
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: The agreement comes two weeks after Luminar accused its billionaire founder of dodging information requests, as it evaluates potential legal claims.

item.title: Why Serve Robotics is acquiring a hospital assistant robot company
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Diligent Robotics is a startup that builds robots designed to assist in hospitals by delivering lab samples, supplies, and other tasks. The deal values Diligent's common stock at $29 million.

item.title: Trump administration admits DOGE may have misused Americans’ Social Security data
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: The revelation comes as part of a series of corrections in a legal case over DOGE’s access to Social Security Administration data.

item.title: UStrive security lapse exposed personal data of its users, including children
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: The online mentoring site UStrive exposed email addresses, phone numbers, and other non-public information to other logged-in users. The nonprofit told TechCrunch that the issue is now fixed, but wouldn't commit to alerting affected individuals.

item.title: Ethernovia raises $90M as investors rush to fund ‘physical AI’
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: The automotive-focused company is looking to expand its Ethernet-based processors to fields like robotics.

item.title: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy says tariffs are starting to drive up product prices
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Jassy said on Tuesday that while Amazon is trying to keep prices low, price hikes may be unavoidable in some cases.

item.title: ICE becomes one of the most-blocked accounts on Bluesky after its verification
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: ICE has been verified on Bluesky, and quickly becomes one of the top most-blocked accounts.

item.title: Retail startup Another raises a $2.5M seed to help sell excess inventory
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Another hopes to help companies address excess inventory before brands opt to sell items to bulk resellers. Corina Marshall, Another's founder, says items sold through such resellers may be deeply discounted, an outcome brands might not want.

item.title: One of the first alternative app stores in the EU is shutting down
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Setapp Mobile, one of the first alternative app stores in the EU, is shutting down next month, citing Apple's ever-changing terms.

item.title: Grubhub parent acquires restaurant rewards startup Claim
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: The acquisition will give restaurants on Grubhub access to Claim’s customer acquisition and retention tools, while Grubhub diners can receive rewards.

item.title: Humans&, a ‘human-centric’ AI startup founded by Anthropic, xAI, Google alums, raised $480M seed round
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Humans&, a startup that believes AI should empower people, not replace them, has reportedly raised a $480 million seed round at a $4.48 billion valuation.

item.title: Eat App wants a bite of India’s restaurant reservation business with an acquisition and Swiggy partnership
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Eat App is making India its central focus to market its reservation and dine-in growth suite.

item.title: SpaceX didn’t properly inspect crane before collapse at Starbase, OSHA says
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: The federal safety agency has hit SpaceX with a $115,850 fine after finding seven "serious" violations during its investigation.

item.title: Netflix is rolling out a live voting feature
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Netflix said that the feature will work globally, and the platform will tally votes in real time. Viewers will have a limited time to vote, and once that time has lapsed, additional votes won't count. That means if you're watching the show later, you can't participate in the voting.

item.title: Netflix revises offer to pay all cash for Warner Bros. to fend off Paramount
item.dc:creator: Ram Iyer
item.description: However, the streaming giant is still offering the same $27.75 the companies had agreed on for WBD's movie studio and streaming assets, and the deal continues to value the company at $82.7 billion.
